results.title: Developmental disabilities
results.creator_credit: Helen Edwards, Sally Collier, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, N S W
results.brief_description: Presents a rationale for service delivery to the intellectually disabled, defines developmental disabilities, distinguishes between the terms impairment, disability and handicap, examines developmental disabilites from a social perspective, examines effects upon lifestyle, constructs the interventions that flow from the medical, behavioural and social models, and examines possible future service directions. Accompanied by 41p. in-service training manual. The video content does not parallel the information presented in the training manual. The program is more an overview of the integration of the developmentally disabled into the community.

results.title: Edward Scissorhands (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lonely old inventor in a castle upon a hill dies and leaves his greatest creation, a boy called Edward, unfinished. Instead of hands, the boy has sharp shears of metal. Until his rescue by a kindly Avon lady who takes him home to the pastel paradise of suburbia, Edward lives alone in darkness. “Edward Scissorhands” is more than a fairy tale by masterful director Tim Burton. This is a satire/allegory which is both funny and moving. Johhny Depp as Edward is a gentle creature full of pathos, yet dignified; much less a monster than the fickle humans who at first embrace him and then seek to destroy him. Dianne Weist stars as Avon Lady Peg, and Winona Ryder as her daughter, Kim. The sets are typical of Burton’s famed surreal style. “Edward Scissorhands” is a film of great poignancy with its own special beauty.

results.title: Ladyhawke (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Lauren Shuler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A haunting tale of magic and mysticism set in an age of enchantment and adventure. Navarre (Rutger Hauer) and Isabeau (Michelle Pfeiffer) are two lovers, condemned to spend eternity together - yet never touch, transformed by the spell of the corrupt Bishop Aquila. Aided by the young renegade thief, “Phillipe the mouse” (Matthew Broderick) and defrocked priest, Imperius (Leo McKern), they must find a moment in time when night and day are one - and evil consumes itself to break the spell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Donner, Lauren Shuler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Eat the rich
results.creator_credit: Peter Richardson, Tim Van Rellim and Ironfist Pictures
results.brief_description: From the makers of the “Comic strip” and the “Young Ones”, this black and often tasteless comedy is certain to startle. Alex, a black waiter at a celebrated restaurant for the rich called “Bastards”, is sacked. Determined to wreak revenge, he organises a people’s take over and captures the restaurant. Renaming it “Eat the Rich”, Alex and his friends serve up their own special brand of millionaires mince. Not for the faint-hearted and with a heavy metal soundtrack by Motorhead.

results.title: Drug use & young people: together we can make a difference
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Human Services and Victoria. Office of Youth Affairs
results.brief_description: Terry Laidler presents the second in a series of interactive seminars linking a Statewide panel via satellite to 25 rural centres. The Victorian Premier’s Drug Advisory Council report forms the basis of discussion surrounding the issue of youth drug use in Victoria. The panel includes The Hon. Denis Napthine, Minister, Youth & Community Services, Professor Greg Whelan, Alcohol and Drug Unit, St. Vincent’s Hospital, Robert Bellhouse, a writer of drug education material for use in schools and Peter Wearne, director of Theos Youth Centre (St. Kilda) with 20 years experience working with young people in crisis. During the seminar, the panel fields questions from studio participants, by fax and telephone.

results.title: Tibet: the roof of the world
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
For many years, Tibet was a land shrouded in mystery, shadowed by the mighty Himalayas and closed to western travellers. This travelogue takes the viewer into the heart of Tibet and its people. From the wonderous Potola, once home to the Tibetan spirtual leader, the Dalai Lama, to the mountain herders and their yaks, to carpet factories where weavers work for months on elaborate designs, this is an incredible journey through a rugged landscape. The intensly spiritual nature of Tibetans and the incredibly beautiful monastaries and elaborate rituals which celebrate their faith are testimony to the country’s strong commitment to Buddhist principles.

results.title: Thumbelina
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman, John Pomeroy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hans Christian Andersen’s classic fairy tale tells the story of a tiny girl called Thumbelina. One magical night she meets Prince Cornelius, an enchanted fairy as tiny as herself, and she is sure she has found true love. Before their romance can blossom, she is kidnapped by a show business family of toads, waylaid by a scheming beetle and betrothed to a befuddled mole. Thumbelina’s journey home is fraught with adventure, but at last she comes to believe that if she follows her heart, nothing is impossible. Music by Barry Manilow. Features the voices of Jodie Benson, Carole Channing and John Hurt.

results.title: Zoo
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: David spends a happy day at the zoo looking at and feeding all the animals. When he returns home, he makes a zoo of his own. The animals come to life and the monkeys imprison the keeper and begin to release the other animals. Disaster threatens but Elsie the elephant comes to the rescue. Cast: Aaron Judah. Narration: Aaron Judah. Music: Alan Lane.

results.title: Sisters are doin' it for themselves: women in the contemporary music industry
results.creator_credit: Greg Ferguson, Lindy Morrrison, AUSMUSIC and Conspiracy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic music industry skills”.
Module 4.5. Pursuing a career in the rock music industry is not easy for women and the path to success is often difficult. Lindy Morrison, an ex-band member of the groups The Go-Betweens and Cleopatra Wong, interviews women who have worked in artistic and non-artistic roles in the industry. In terms of gender balance, radio airplay, income and participant numbers, there is still room for improvement. Key female industy figures featured include Kylie Minogue, Wendy Matthews and Tina Arena, along with ‘pioneer’ artists such as Judy Stone, Laurel Lee and Little Pattie.

results.title: Donald Brittain: filmmaker
results.creator_credit: Kent Martin, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Donald Brittain was one of the most respected documentary filmmakers of his time and his work with the National Film Board of Canada earned him accolades from his peers and cemented his place in cinema history. This documentary examines the man behind the work and the work itself. He created films about heroes, “exposed villians” and offered filmgoers a “warts and all” expose of his subject and themes. This excellent documentary presents a frank and honest account of Brittain whose gift is described as being able to make the great man common and the common man great.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kent Martin, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
